intro: Cryanthemum tibeticum, commonly known as the Tibetan chrysanthemum, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically blooms in the summer months, producing yellow to orange petals with a central disk of darker color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the cold, arid climate of its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
